title: Distraction as SA Killer
content: Distractions pull attention away from critical monitoring. Phones, conversations, radio traffic, and task interruptions all fragment SA. In high-risk operations, even brief attention gaps can be dangerous. Protect your attention during critical phases. Defer non-essential requests. When distracted, consciously rebuild SA afterward.

mcq.question: During a critical operation, a colleague approaches to ask about scheduling. What should you do?

options.A: Answer quickly to avoid being rude
options.B: Ask them to wait until you reach a stable point in the operation
options.C: Split your attention between both tasks

mcq.explanation: Protecting SA during critical phases is professional, not rude. Request a delay until you can give the conversation proper attention without compromising operational SA.

openQuestions: What distracts you most during critical operations?
How do you protect your attention when interruptions occur?
